column4: okay, how (again) do i find out what's using a particular module?
modules only work for specific hardware
thank you for that bit of wisdom, but that's not what i asked.
what is the question then
the question is what i asked - how to find out what's using a particular module
and if you understood what I said rather than giving me a star response, you'd know
modules can only be used by specific hardware , so therefore if you have an ipw2000 module loaded for example it can ONLY be used by your intel wirless card
processes don't use modules
what modules are you talking about, kernel modules, xorg modules ?
let me give you a quick example
ok, I see what your getting at
with that, thats actually "device file" related
so you know that that module is a "sound" module, so anything using your sound card will need to be shut down
or anything that "locks" your sound card
so in that sort of senario, just work it backwards, eg: module = hardware $X - what software will use hardware $X I'll disalbe it
go to the link that popped up when i entered that
entered what ?
yes it will
ah, nice
wasn't sure that would actually change
base doesn't relese does, check it out
handy to know base release and current update
